Chapter 40. Computer Vision on the GPU
James Fung
University of Toronto
Computer vision tasks are computationally intensive and repetitive, and they often exceed the real-time capabilities of the
CPU, leaving little time for higher-level tasks. However, many computer vision operations map efficiently onto the modern GPU,
whose programmability allows a wide variety of computer vision algorithms to be implemented. This chapter presents methods
of efficiently mapping common mathematical operations of computer vision onto modern computer graphics architecture.
